The best part of the meal was what I think was the deluxe tomatillo sauce. Thank you random stranger for ordering this it made eating everything much better! 

Now all of this would have probably warranted a 2 rating except for a couple things. First, Chuy's charges a "packaging fee" for to go orders. I didn't see any mention of this anywhere on their website. Hidden fees are not cool! The other reason for the low rating is that both of us had upset stomachs after eating our various items.

I've never had a bad experience here. The food and service is always amazing. My personal favorite is the chicka chicka boom boom enchiladas or the macho burrito Friday special as seen in the picture attached
Wow this place blows all the places I have eating. What a fun place to eat.  They have a huge menu to choose from.  Huge drink selection also. Definitely see one go to it!

I'm not usually a big fan of "Tex-Mex", but we were hunting a place for lunch and thought we'd give Chuy's a try.  I'm so glad we did cause it was yummy  :-)  

The place is so interesting visually that I found myself distracted on numerous occasions during our lunch.  From the moment you walk in, your eyes are drawn to colorful entertaining images everywhere.  The service was great, the food was reasonably priced (considering it's at South Park) and the sweet tea was tasty.  We all left full and satisfied.  

My only issue is the parking- you've REALLY got to want to eat here to deal with the enormous hassle that South Park always has with their parking areas being way too tight and not nearly enough spaces.  I'm not a "mixed use" space kind of gal, I like open spaces and plenty of room- neither are present at South Park.  I guess if you're a local resident and wanted to walk it would be fine, but for me, it's just not worth the hassle when I can get Mexican food on any corner all over town.

Found a bug in my salad halfway through eating it... And not just a little fruit fly... This was a HUGE CRAWLING BUG! I was so disgusted. Thankfully, they said they would refund me but I will never be back.

This place is the wort.  Staff is friendly and maybe someday will get its act together.  They bill themselves as "world famous" but I have no idea what world they are talking about.  Place is noisy,has created noxious odors throughout the Shops at the Village of SouthPark, has kids that run crazy around the fountain with little or no adult supervision. food is plentiful but also about the worst Tex Mex ever,  Do yourself a favor and run for your life from here.  So many other good places in Charlotte.  One other thing - how the h.. did Simon properties let them get away with the totally obnoxious pink exterior that is totally out of place in the Village.  Somebody needs their head examined.  Avoid this place at all costs!!!!!!

Completely disrespectful. My wife and I came in and sat at the patio. Our waitress Christin came over and asked for drinks, we both got waters, she came back with them and chips and salsa and then things seemed to horribly decline. 

My wife asked a simple question about a menu option (about being able to select a certain enchilada on a combo) she seemed very annoyed, rudely said "I'll make it happen." Then just walked to take my order. We both wanted Charro beans instead of refried beans but were both so distracted by the attitude, we completely forgot and she never asked what kind we wanted anyway.

Following this she never came back to refill our chips and salsa or waters, and ignored us, we watched her bring more to several other tables around us. (We know she saw we were out of everything as she looked at our table several times) We sat there with nothing left to snack on and no water. (See Pics) we literally finished the entire meal and sat around for about 15 minutes and she never once even asked or offered anything. Following our food coming out, she didn't even check back in to be sure everything was ok or that it had come out correctly.

After about 15 more minutes of sitting there trying to figure out what we could have possibly done to her, she returned with the check without asking about needing anything else, or dessert (which we originally planned on getting). At this point she did ask if we wanted boxes and we declined. When she returned with my card, she sat it down on the table next to me and said "here you go." And then walked off. No "Thank You", no nothing. So awkward.

On the bright side, the girl who ran our food out was really polite and thankfully she came because we weren't given napkins or utensils. Not sure what her name was, she seemed around 20's possibly and had several tattoos and she was great. The food was also pretty good and the space had a nice vibe, but that was crushed by our waitress who just seemed mad at the world.

Overall, the food was very good, but the service killed this place for us. And just to clarify, the restaurant was busy, but not crazy and she seemed to tend to the tables to our left and right without any trouble. We just felt very singled out for no reason, it was very strange.

We first went to Chuy's not long after they opened, and perhaps for that reason, were not impressed. It took a while to go back, and it turns out, we just don't seem to be fans of the place.

There is a bit of kitschy appeal to the place, the food definitely takes a backseat to the overall decor. They've done a nice job of revamping the joint so that it looks nothing like Zink - though Zink was actually a pretty decent place (especially that patio!) before.

On the inside, you have trees, and noise and kids and, like others have side, IT IS LOUD. Maybe I'm showing my age more and more, but I could do without all the extra props and noise - I'd much rather have better food instead. What is there is okay, but when you throw everything else into the mix, it's just not worth it.

Stopped here on a whim and so glad we did! We were driving down the road actually going somewhere else for dinner and the sign caught my eye. For some reason switched plans on the fly!

This was our first time at a Chuy's and our waiter did a great job giving us a rundown of the menu. He brought out our chips with salsa and a thing of Jalapeño crime sauce... wow. So good. I ordered the a huge steak burrito that was very very good. The amount of food was insane and I simply could not finish it.

Prices are about what you would expect and just an overall good first experience, no doubt in my mind we will return at some point.

I've been coming to Chuy's since back in the olden days when it was located all the way in Southpark. I used to travel there via my RC car. Sometimes the battery on the remote would die on my way there and I would have to phone a miniature horse to get me the rest of the way. Once Chuys moved to its new location it only became a few days away traveling by hot air balloon. I come here often when I can get my hot air balloon to start up. This place is as good as some butternut squash on a hot day. When I come here I try to see how many chips I can stuff in my body before they ask what I want as an entree so that I can leave like the cheapskate that I am. I prefer the creamy jalapeño dip here, it is fantastic. A lot better than the chunky, moldy cheese that I've had in my refrigerator for the past 2 decades :)

I've been to Chuy's before but just not at this location. We came here on a friday night and there was a 45 min to an hour wait. Eh, ok we will wait. We sat at the bar and ordered drinks. They have a nacho bar from 4-7 and it was fantastic. That definitely made time go by fast. We probably waited about 45 mins and got sat at a booth. 

Our server was very nice and gave good ideas on food. Burritos are huge and fantastic. I got the appetizer sampler. It was good. Came with an assortment of food. I noticed I had 1 quesadilla but I saw a picture on yelp for this location that someone got 2. No biggie. Salsa is very fresh. Jalapeno sauce is also good. I already have in mind of what I wanna try. 

I seriously can't wait to go back!

The food was just okay, very small menu, the server lacked enthusiasm and never even told us her name. I had high hopes because I heard good things- but to be honest is was just run of the mill Mexican food.  The only thing I was impressed with was the homemade tortillas but that won't be enough to bring me back. Lastly, I am a wine drinker- only offering Barefoot wine (they have one wine on their menu) that alone was enough to keep me from returning.

Been to the one  in Greenville  but this was nothing like it. Service was slow. Beverage service was slow. Location did not have the fun feel of other places. Food was good though, but our waiter was so bad I would have to give 3 stars. 
Love the Greenville location, you guys should go have dinner there and see what you need to do

This place was great! I'm actually lactose intolerant, so I had to work around the menu, but the staff was so friendly and helpful. They helped me pick out something that satisfied my tastebuds as well as my diet needs. The chips are great as well!

I've wanted to try Chuy's for awhile and after tonight's experience I'm not sure I'll ever come back.  It was busy Saturday night but some reason the pager the hostess gave us didn't work.  After inquiring about our table we found out the pager didn't work.  So the hostess told us to wait even longer.  The bartender...Brian was very nice and helpful.  He even comps us some for waiting.  
After getting to the table our waitress disappeared...and after awhile we decided to leave.  I don't know if the food is any good but the service here is terrible!!

I've had better food at Taco Bell. I was so disappointed in the food here I don't know where to start. First off the chips were too thin for my taste. It kept breaking every time I tried to get some dip. I got one of the combos that come with chicken. enchilada and chicken chalupa. It looked almost the same as my friend's combo, who had a Taco and enchilada???? If anything my chalupa looked more like a tostada. It came with rice and beans. I told my server that I didn't eat beans he stated he would give me two sides of rice. When the food came I got beans and rice. (Honest mistake, I told the runner that gave us the food. She told me she would bring it out and we never got it) I usually eat all my food...my friend and I ate less than half of both of our foods. The only reason I'm giving them two stars is because our server was nice and refilled our cups and chips often. The nacho bar that was included with our meal was nice, though there was only three things to select from. It probably woulda been better to have salsa or hot sauce available at the bar. With that being said though, I also added points for the dips we got at the table (salsa and guacamole). Just for those two points though, I wouldn't come and eat their food again. I might come back for some drinks because they looked good but that's it lol.

I came here twice! The first time was not a great experience. The servers didn't seem focused on working. We saw our server go out to his car with several girls while we were waiting 10 plus minutes for our margaritas. Food was bad, it was cold, dry and my fish was "fishy". I was not upset, I understood they could of had a rough night. So I came back to give them a second chance. Once again poor service and poor food. 
Suggestions - Educate and inform staff how to properly run a restaurant. Make sure food is fresh and not dry and pasty. Maybe new management?? I mean idk. I hope others have better experiences.

There is nothing better when you are hungover than chips, salsa, and queso. And a giant Coke. And a nap afterwards. 

This isn't your typical Mexican joint. The decor is wacky. They sell hysterical t-shirts. The place is massive. I'm pretty sure you could play an endless game of hide and seek here. 

The chips are light, the salsa has a kick to it. They have a ton of different sauce options here. I really like the queso. Menu wise, I think I get something different each visit based on what I'm craving. I'm a big fan of the Classic Tex-Mex enchiladas. I mean, how can you go wrong with something covered in chili and cheese? Chuy's also does daily specials and has different drink deals each week night. 

I've always had great service and everyone is so nice here. It's hard not to smile when you're here. It's just a fun and happy place.

Went here on a Friday night (honestly because we couldn't get into Cowfish) and it was mediocre at best. 

Started off with the house chips and salsa and ordered a side of guacamole. The salsa was too spicy for a house salsa, with lots of jalapeño seeds. The guacamole was flavorless. No flavor what so ever. Squeezed my margarita lime into it and added table salt. Still didn't help.

I ordered the chicka-chicka boom boom per the managers request and enjoyed the boom boom sauce, but that was about it. The rice was dry and the beans bland. Canned beans are better. 

My boyfriend ordered the combination dinner; the sirloin taco meat looked questionable. 

I was expecting this to be a decent Mexican restaurant but it was beyond sub-par. We won't be going back.

As always delicious and nutritious!  Not as busy as expected for a Saturday night with a Panthers Game. Server was very comedic, and attentive. Big as yo face burrito with oven roasted chicken, creamy jalapeño sauce on top...MUST have. Only dislike my lime wedge was cut too big to fit into my corona. I wouldn't  recommend the bar area tables for 3+ people, either. The Sangria my girlfriend had was tasty. I don't know why other tex-mex restuarants in Charlotte even try to compete.

Chuy's texmex food is very disappointing. The food doesn't have any flavor what so ever. I was highly disappointed. I was looking forward to Spanish restaurant near my house, however it was not to my liking. I will not be back here. I have had texmex before but I have never had it before with little to no flavor.

i had heard good things about this place and was excited about its opening near me.  We went when it opened in Dec and had horrible service and food was mediocre at best   i chalked it up to a new opening and figured I would give it settling time.  So we came again tonight.  Waited at least 10 min before being acknowledged.  We were finally brought drinks after 2 servers came to us, 1 beer and 1 margarita.  Took another 5 min and asking where my daughter's coke was before we got it.  Food was ok, not the best but not the worst.  Could have maybe been ok with it and coming back 1 more time.  However, ordered another drink and waited 15 min, 2 servers checking and both said it was coming.  When it was finally brought to me 1 of the servers whispers to me how bad the bartender is and that they are tying to get rid of him.  Proceeds to tell they have had multiple firings for drinking behind the bar.  Needless to say I doubt I will be giving more of my money to this establishment or recommending it to anyone else

The worst. There quesadilla tortilla shells were made of flat bread, so it was like eating a biscuit with Mexican chicken and cheese. Not good at all. My husband said his food was kind of bland. I wouldn't eat there again.

Sadly we won't be back. This place always seemed to have a wait, so we strategically popped in for a late lunch. Upon arrival the hostess seriously appeared as though we were bothering her. She dumped us at a table right in front of the kitchen (seriously high traffic and the waitstaff kept knocking my purse off the back of my chair). We ultimately moved to a booth. The young lady that waited on us was sweet. VERY YOUNG, so I can let it slide that we waited a long time for her to take our order or check on us. (Seriously, we never complain about that either - but it was a noteworthy amount of time between visits to our table). The guy who filled our chips was hysterical. He appeared so angry at everyone and definitely seemed hung over - at one point he literally missed half the basket and chips were all over the table and on our laps. (Nope, he didn't even look at us to notice his mess or our chuckle). The food was fine - came out warm, was seemingly fresh, but a bit sloppy (tacos had cheese, lettuce and such falling out instead of actually just being on the side). Our little guy seriously LOVED the kid mini tacos and he cleaned up the rice and beans too, so that's something. (He never does that). If service was a bit less comically tragic, we'd consider going back - but it's ok, we figure it'll catch up eventually. This place is rocking busy and people won't tolerate that for long before Management catches on. We'll try again in the fall.

4 stars for Great atmosphere!!!!

But overall the food was too SPICY. We actually like hot food ,but this was so hot/not enjoyable, starting with the complementary salsa that comes with the chips on the table. We have eaten at Chuys before, and this was not the same. When we asked for less heat in the salsa, they graciously brought us different sauces that were milder. 

There was WAY too much jalapeño in everything we ordered, except for the guacamole and the kids' meals. But that may just be our taste.

On the bright side: Our waiter was great, and the service was fast. 

The kids loved it too!

My only truly negative comment is that there seemed to be way more hostesses than needed (3+ on a Sunday afternoon) , to the point that they would rather stand around socializing than bring people to their tables. And the girl who originally greeted us was sitting off to the side on a bench with a giant make-up kit, putting on her make up, not even acknowledging guests, when we left. Very unprofessional.
Im from Texas and never found any good Tex mex food till I came here to chuy's people who say it isn't good it's a huge lie I'm from Texas I know the food and this place to the best

Good run of the mill Mexican food-tried this location instead of Southpark. Same great chips and salsa. The staff was a bit harried but, they just opened so....

Outdoor area to sit and eat/drink. Located in the Waverly complex-this will be a mad house in a few years. Parking lot with multiple other shops and restaurants and apartments.

We came here about a month ago. I didn't feel that the interior of the restaurant matched the exterior. That is, the restaurant looks really nice on the outside, very inviting. However, once inside, felt it was very, well, meh.... The inside is nothing to rave about and they have tried to give an "outdoor feel" to being inside. This usually doesn't work. Further, there are pictures on the wall of who-knows-who, and they just seemed really out of place with everything else.

The food was bland. I had the soft tacos and the beef was overcooked. The "regular salsa" was scorching hot (way too spicy). Portions were large. Nothing to write home about. Service was good and attentive. Prices were okay. Nothing really special about this place to make me want to come back.

I really dig this place! The atmosphere is great - laid back, fun and just makes you feel relaxed... like the first sip of booze after a long day of work  : ) 

The prices are incredible for a place in South Park. Thanks for not price gouging because of your location, Chuy's!

The first time I stopped by I had the Chimy Chimy Bang Bang - quite tasty! The entree comes smothered in bang bang sauce whic is definitely worth asking for a side of even if you don't get this dish. And the jalapeno ranch - ask for a side with your tortilla chips. I'm actually not a fan of ranch (I think I'm the only person to ever say that) but this dip with a bit thicker. Creamier and a smooth, cool flavors. 

Awesome side note, go Monday thru Friday during the week between 4 and 7pm - free queso car! Complete with several salsas, yellow queso, black beans and ground beef. Yum!
Good times! Great food. Great service. Got the chicka chicka boom boom and it was all that and more.

Not a fan of it. Never have been and think I will never be. When they opened it. I tried it again and it's just another concept trying to make it big with no vision. The tortillas are way too thick. The steak tasted cheap. The presentation is not even worth the price. You are better off going to on the border and I won't even recommend anyone going there.

Let me start out by saying......  I'm from Texas.  I've been to the original one in Austin and frequently visited the one in my hometown back in Dallas.  Saying this to say that's how much I'm a firm believer of Chuy's.  I love this place.  I can now check off my go-to place for Tex-Mex in the charlotte area. 

Was able to check out Chuy's last night and I was so greatful.  The restuarant is bursting with color.  It's well lit, it's spacious, and they've expanded the patio area in the back.  The reasons why I love Chuy's:

1.  Prices.  My Baja fish tacos (Had grilled shrimp) were $8.99 for TWO and it came with the good'ole refried beans and rice.  That's dirt cheap in South Park.  Other places are $10.99 for two tacos.  They were so good.  Suggest putting them on corn tortillas instead of flour.  What's up with folks putting fish tacos on flour tortillas??  haha!  The food items on the menu are good.  You can't pick a bad dish.  They're all good.  I didn't try them all last night, but I'm confident that it'll be good.  Staff from Texas came here to train the workers in CLT, decorate, and participate so I know that they're really into consistancy across all of their locations.  

2.  It's just a fun, causual, laid back place to eat.  Sure, there are other places around that are prob just as casual, but there's just something about having that non-fluffy stuffy mexican food.  It's just good ole Tex-Mex.  No it's not authentic.  It's Tex-Mex.  

3.  Margaritas.  They're good.  Enough Said.  Well....wait.  I will say that my favorite was the Texas Martini.  It's a margarita but it comes in a martini glass and a huge plastic shaker that you poor yourself.  smh....so you can either go big and just drink the giant margarita from the shaker (lol) or sip and stroll and pace yourself.  Made with Patron and another taquilla.  Well worth the moolah for that Texas-sized drink.  

They have Kitschy-cool decor and it makes no sense but I love it.  There's a salsa bar that's in the back of an old car...i think?  That was funny.  There are pictures of chihuahuas dressed up in people clothes on the walls.  Makes me giggle.  

Give it a whirl.  It's just another place for those in South Park to try if they want some good no-fuss Tex-Mex food.  The guac I was slightly disapointed in.  It's normally flavored more so I'm hoping that works itself out.  The patio is awesome and can't wait to have a Texas-sized margarita on the patio in Clt.

yee-haw!
Wife and I went here a few days ago. We had the fajitas which were amazing. The charro beans were outstanding too. Definitely recommend.

I came here for lunch. The meal comes with chips and Salsa. The chips are light and crunchy and the salsa spicy and tasty. This is the best chips and salsa I have had in Charlotte!

 I ordered the steak burrito which came with charro beans and green chili rice. The chunks of steak was really tender and flavorful. The burrito came with some type of brown sauce on the top and the sides. I think it's some sort of beef broth sauce but it had a nice surprising spiciness to it.   The Charo beans were good and I'm not usually a big fan.  I am well pleased  with the meal.  The portion was big for a lunch selection. It's big even for a dinner selection.

The service was ok. The server did his job. I just didn't think he wanted to be there. He wasn't rude or anything.  Just my opinion.  Everyone's entitled to a bad day.  I will be back.

Loved this place! Some may say that the decor is a bit overwhelming and a sensory overload but that's what I love about it! It's kitschy theme of everything Tex-Mex to Elvis is what makes Chuy's a dining experience unlike any other. 
Ohh yea, the food's not bad either! I ordered the Chica-Chica-Boom-Boom and it was delicious. It had just the right amount of spice and zing. All their entrées are the perfect balance of traditional Mexican with a Texan flair to it. 
I would without a doubt recommend this restaurant to everyone and go back in a heart beat!

Chuy's is a breath of tex mex air to Charlotte. For over a decade I have pined away for true Mexican food and now I have found it. 
Everything is great here. My current crush is the steak tacos al carbon. If this is your first time here you have to have the fajitas. I also like the flautas. Great kids menu and the patio is heated with TVs. The service is fast and friendly. 
The Perfect Margarita is near perfect -  good amount of tequila.

It's like a greasy Taco Bell, but slightly more expensive. If you want good mexican go to a real mexican restaurant. This is a chain and not a very good one. Nothing on the menu is remotely healthy except maybe the salads. Greasy chips, greasy tacos.

I enjoyed this place. Fun retro-designed interior, large portions of food. Cool location as well (in the up-and-coming "Waverly Neighborhood" by Ballantyne). Food doesn't have a "wow" factor but it's still a pretty fun place. I knocked off 1 star for the food being "pretty-good-not-great" and the crappy beer selection. Definitely worth going if you are in the area.

The environment is very welcoming and happy. I tried this place because they always bring free food into my work. I absolutely love their salsa! So fresh and spicy! They food is never disappointing. Very good spicy ranch sauce also. Yum.

I love Chuy's.  I like the salsa the best and even come get it for carryout frequently.  It really is one of the best salsas I've tried in a long time.  

I followed this restaurant from South Park to its new Waverly location.  I usually get a la carte tacos because they are the best deal for me, since I don't like beans or rice.  The tacos are really good.  The meat (ground  beef) is full of flavor and the shells are crisp and delicious.  All of the insides are fresh.  

The service is awesome.  The staff greets you at the door and makes you feel right at home.  The restaurant, being brand new, is extremely clean and well organized.

Authentic Mexican food! A friend claimed this was the best Mexican food in Charlotte - and he might be right. 

As soon as we sat down, they served us an endless amount of chips + salsa. The chips were thin and fresh and the salsa had a bit of a kick. We ordered the queso and Mmmm, so good. 

If you're deciding between the house margarita and the Texas martini - go Texas!! Same price and you get much more bang for your buck. 

I was most excited about my main course - the southwestern plate. so good!! A sunny side egg on top of soft blue tortillas filled with pulled chicken pulled chicken, topped  with an impeccable sauce. Comes with rice, beans and a little bit of lettuce. So authentic and fresh!

Let's say you have four hungry, noisy, picky eaters... This would NOT be the right place to bring them. Noisy is ok, because the acoustics inside made it hard to hear myself think, so kids who squabble, sing, and push each other out of their chairs (we are still talking hypothetically) don't bug any of the other patrons. But someone, and the waitress assured me it wasn't her, couldn't get the orders straight.  On the first attempt, 5 out of 6 of the meals were so wrong they had to go back. It was like they brought the wrong table's grub. Second try, only two were wrong. They got them all right on the 3rd attempt, and comped everything. I think that if we had ordered as is from the menu without all of our hold-the-cheeses, it would not have been a teary disaster.  The food was pretty good when we got it. On weeknights, they have a free nacho bar from 4-7.
Food was good service was not on par the waiter mixed up my wife's and I drinks up she is diabetic can't have sweet tea but easy fix other then that would have gave 5 stars

I've been here three times.  The food is good, but the service leaves much to be desired.  The second time I came here, our table of 6 waited over 30 minutes to order and then another hour and 20 minutes for the food to come out.  After that experience I vowed to never return.   Two years later, my husband dragged me back stating that they had improved. We came in on a Friday during the lunch hour, the restaurant was barely filled with people. Just like with our other visits, the food was good.  The service was much improved from my last visit, but still slow given how empty the restaurant was. At every point of the process, we were just hanging out waiting for the server to return. Side note, I would not recommend their sweet tea to anyone, it was weak and watered down.

Chuy's is AWESOME!!! Guess what's even more awesome besides the food...THOMAS, one of the servers!

First of all, the decor is fantastic. The hostess was perky and friendly. As mentioned before, Thomas was an incredible server. He made sure our chips were frequently refilled, gave great suggestions, and kept a genuine smile on his face. 

Ok, enough about the cute server. 

The food! It was super delicious! I got the Chuy's special which was composed of blue corn tortillas filled with roasted chicken, covered in tomatillo sauce and topped with sour cream. Delish! The side sauce of creamy jalapeno was also a great addition. I also had a frozen strawberry margarita...it was extra yummy. 

I'm glad Chuy's has arrived. The place is massive, and while I LOVE Cowfish, having Chuy's right beside it as a marvelous alternative is pretty sweet. Not that Chuy's is just an alternative to Cowfish... 

Ok, what are you waiting for? Go! Go! Go!

Best Mexican in Charlotte!  

We loved the chicka chicka boom boom. Chips and salsa are delish!  The best Jalepeno salsa on the planet.

Horrible experience. Service sucked. Food sucked. I'm usually a very patient patron because I work at a restaurant and I know how things are but this was seriously one of the worst eating experiences I have had. Taco Bell is better than this place.

Zip-A-Dee-Do-Da it's a wonderful day -- the day I stepped inside a Chuy's for the first time! It's colorful and inviting. Our waiter could not have been more upbeat and helpful. They even have a free mother-slapping NACHO BAR!!!! 

The colors and smells and sights, they combine for a delightful time. I went with friends so it was even more enjoyable.

I ordered the Elvis Presley combination and had no idea how giant it would actually be -- not to mention is was only $11 and change.

I almost forgot to mention the amazing ranch/jalapeño dip -- I need an intravenous drip of the stuff because it's THAT good. So, yourself a flavor and find a Chuy's. They're even changing the way I think about chain restaurants -- maybe.

Miss good TexMex places like this from Texas. Any place that makes their own tortillas in house automatically gets a 5-star review from me (unless there's something significantly wrong).

Nacho/Queso bar from 4-7pm for happy hour definitely makes it a bonus for an early dinner.

I hadn't been to Chuys in a while. Every time the wait was 45-60 minutes. No more. The place was weirdly empty even though the wait at Cowfish was more than an hour.  We were greeted by a man who said: I have no idea what to do - I'm a busboy. 

Food was ok but service was terrible. Apps and food came out at the same time. And too fast to be fresh. Our waiter was frantic and inattentive. He didn't bring water or napkins. He tried to clear the table while we were still eating. He was fast at bringing the check. He seemed like he just wanted us to get of there. He never offered coffee or dessert. The table next to us had to grab someone from the front to order dessert. 

Won't go back anytime soon - no matter how long the Cowfish wait is.

I'll start off with saying that the prices for the location of this restaurant are outstanding! I went this past weekend with a friend to enjoy sitting outside. The patio was quite enjoyable! 

We started at the bar since the patio was full and I wanted a "fresh" mojito. You know the one that doesn't include mountains of simple syrup, etc. The bartender was very accomodating and made me a great mojito! 

Our table was ready in just a few minutes and a nice gentlemen showed us to the patio which I believe was the manager. The service was great all around so that's a huge plus! They give you free chips, salsa, and jalapeno ranch (I believe). They were both great, I loved the spice in the salsa. However, I am giving 3 1/2 stars due to the actual food. The guacamole was just eh and the queso was oily/incredibly salty. The chicken quesadillas were bland and full of cheese. And my least favorite were some sort of chimys. Horribly bland and the sauce ontop was even worse. I really wanted to enjoy this place but maybe I should have gotten something else!

My family recently decided to try out this new Mexican restaurant. The chips and salsa were only ok, not fantastic. 

Sadly, the food was very poor. Nothing special about the dishes we ordered. Our server disappeared for quite some time and we were left thirsty while we waited. We wanted some more chips and my son finally went to get them for us.

I faced some challenges since I was a vegan/vegetarian and asked for the vegetable burrito without the tortilla. The quantity of vegetables was tiny and I left hungry. One son ordered a combination platter of a variety of offerings. He did not enjoy any of them. The best part was that this place was close to home so there wasn't a long drive and the drink special was a margarita. I think the drink price was good.

We do NOT want to ever return. My older son said that his friends are not picky and love the quantity of food at cheap prices. We are more inclined to eat less and prefer tasty food.

Oh, I almost forgot, they have very creative ceiling details and strange paintings of dogs everywhere too.

I was very disappointed in this place.  Honestly, the only reason I gave it two stars is because the queso dip was very good. The chips were overly salted even for my wife who usually puts salt on EVERYTHING.  Also, the waiteress kept bringing more chips in this giant scoop and each time spilled about half of them onto the table.  I make a big enough mess without the waiteress helping.

My wife had the quesedilla.  It was served as what looked like 4 minature tacos.  Which would not be bad, except that the tortillas were oily and flavorless.  My wife said the chicken and cheese was just OK.

I had chile rellenos with shrimp and cheese.  The breading didn't stick to the chiles and the chiles were too crunchy.  The filling was just OK.  To be honest, I would have just preferred to have a plate with just the filling.

If you know me, you know I love free things... You know what's better, though?  When the free stuff is delicious... 

Apparently, Chuy's has the happiest of happy hours... Why?  From 4 until 7 on weekdays, inside their pretty, pretty locale is a trunk of a car... Inside that trunk?  Chips, queso, ground beef, refried beans and various salsas... FOR FREE... What's that you say?  Yep... In addition to their tasty drinks (which also have daily specials), they give you some delicious nacho components on the gratis tip... Love it... The chips were light, but didn't get soggy under toppings... The salsas weren't really spicy, but they have hot sauce if you want it... The ground beef had a good seasoning without being salty and the queso was super tasty... The beans tasted like refried beans... 

We tried the frozen and rocks version of the Chuy's Classic Sangrias and they were both delicious... Not too strong, but you knew what was in there...

My favorite part, though?  Next to the nacho car is a small sink... You can wash your hands right there!  That makes my heart light... I mean, how much easier can you make it for people? Fabulous... I do think they should put a little more distance between the nacho trays and the sink, though, because they're right next to it... Maybe move the upside down salsa bowls over instead so people that don't dry their hands with the available paper products don't shake their leftover water into the nacho trays?  And add a little trash can next to the side... I had to bring my paper towel with me to the bar... Someone could have taken it to empty and forgot to bring it back, though... 

Overall, it was fantastic, though... I can't wait to go back and try more things here!

Cheap forgettable food in a loud, bright atmosphere. A fork and knife in  paper bag on your table. Service is what you would expect from an overworked staff. Our waitress was pleasant but hard to find when you wanted something. The chips are tasty but so thin its impossible to dip any guac with them. The salsa is more of a Pico De Gallo than salsa you may be used to. It's fresh, tasty and has a nice little kick from fresh minced chilis. For my dinner, the beef burrito was more beans than anything else. The side of rice was dry and tasteless. I ordered a beer and I was brought a can and I had to request a glass. Maybe an ecomical fun place for a family with several kids? If your idea of a good restaurant is On The Boarder (which is much better in my opinion) or IHOP, you won't be disappointed.

I hate to say this, but this wasn't something to write home about. The chip bar never got refilled and I had to ask the bartender for some more which he brought it to me in a scoop. While the queso was  good, that's all I got that was redemptive. The tacos were good but way overpriced, as was my $5 beer. The service was a tad spotty as well. Won't be back.

For the people that give Chuy's anything less than 4 stars for the food can you please tell me where you will find better TEX-MEX anywhere along the Eastern Seaboard? I went 1 time last week when I was in town for business and this location could thrive in Dallas, Austin, Houston, San Antonio or any other hardcore Tex-Mex competitive city. The service was great and so was the food.
Went here tonight for the first time. It was really good food and great service!

Been to Chuy's three times now. For the most part pretty standard fare for a TexMex place. Good portions on each plate. Can't tell much difference in the two rice options. The chicken is actually kinda bland in the flautas. The nachos are really good because they are not just chips tossed on a plat but rather they have attention placed on each one. The Boom Boom sauce is excellent. My biggest downside is that the last two times we've been there we had the same server and he is extremely lackluster and doesn't pay much attention to his customers. He's walked away from me twice as I was making a drink order and trying to ask for more salsa but he didn't hear because he was walking away from me. I'd definitely want a different server if I went back. Decent place and always busy but not the best Mexican food in the area.

This was our first time at Chuy's.  Bri was our server and she did a great job.  I was very impressed with the entire staff.  The place was very busy, but we didn't wait for a booth. When a party left the staff quickly turned the table around for the next party.  We were regularly visited by Bri and other staff dropped by to make sure everything was okay.  This seemed like a well run operation. 

This is a family restaurant.  Our party was much older than the typical patrons, but that was not a problem.  

The restaurant is surprisingly large in size and is divided into several sections.  Maximum capacity was posted at around 287, as I recall.  They have a large outside open porch/dining area that would have been great if it hadn't been so cold.  Maybe next time.  

I ordered the No 5, which was a chalupa and enchilada, with rice and refried beans.  There are no photos of the dishes, so I ordered strictly by the written description. When it arrived it looked like the sort of dish I would not have typically ordered, but it was fantastic.  Our party also ordered two servings of fajitas and one cheese and bean burrito.  We were all very pleased with the meals.  We will definitely be back.

Go for the margaritas. Stick to the margaritas. Nibble on the chips and salsa. Come back home.

Somehow, I always stray from that plan AND regret it. The food is well, it's Tex-Mex chain food. What do you expect?

The service is good and the salsa bar at Happy Hour doesn't hurt. In fact, I bumped up the rating to a three star thanks to the staff and the free salsa bar.

I just came from one of the worst Southpark dining experiences I've ever had. Actually when I heard that Chuy's was coming to town I was a little surprised; when you think Southpark, Chuy's isn't exactly what I would have in mind. Don't get me wrong, the food was good (Maverick's is better) - service was as well as could be expected given the crowd and how patrons were stuffed into dining rooms like sardines; Chuy's is reminiscent of the restaurant at South of the Border off interstate 95...I swear I was looking for Pedro! This restaurant is definitely geared towards the minivan generation...cheap eats! But don't let the inexpensive menu fool you...it comes at a price. My ears are still ringing from the noise level; kids running around unsupervised and harried servers trying to navigate around kids and overcrowded dining rooms. Given the history of this location (at least four other restaurants have come and gone) I hope that cheap, loud dining will survive in Southpark...if not, I pity the next restaurant that has to redecorate.

I was very disappointed by our first visit to Chuy's in Waverly.   We waited 55 minutes to be seated ( 4 adults,1 child) after being told 30 minutes to start off. Then when we were finally seated we waited 15 minutes until the waitress even came up to take her drink order.  Next, salsa was delivered with no chips and we had not received the drinks yet they arrived about five minutes later.  The waitress then took our order and brought the wrong queso about five minutes later that we sent back.  When the food finally arrived 45 minutes later it was cold and one of our party's salad was not served with the others... We addressed this with the waitress. While we were waiting for her food to arrive about 10 minutes later the waitress comes back and says that she's told the kitchen three times that she was missing the Grilled Chicken Salad but they still have not made it for her so she was sending the manager to our table.  When he arrived he had salad in hand and did not apologize for such the delay.  Very poor service....oh yeah and we had to ask to receive silverware twice.   We will not return

The remodeling job was excellent, you definately could not tell what it was previously and there were no reminders of zink... that was about it. We went close to their grand opening so it was overly packed... we sat near the bar and had people around us all the time, leaning on our chairs, squeezing by, kids running around the table... we forgave all that since they are new but the food was extremely disappointing. I ordered something that reminded me of Lean Cuisine's Chiken Enchalada Sauza... sadly the LC version is much better than what I received. Hardly any chicken, the chicken had ZERO flavor and NO seasoning.. the sauce was ok.. but that was my entire dish... the hand made tortillas were the main part of the dish... fBF had some massive combo plate... it was basically different meats/lots of cheese/tortillas smothered in sauces.. he said it was ok. We both decided that was our first and last visit. Our impression is if you have kids and want to go out someplace they enjoy and eat the food, this is your place. If you want good tex-mex and to enjoy a meal, this isnot.

I had a really great experience at Chuy's. We went at an off time, but the bartender was incredibly friendly, my margarita had a nice kick, and the nachos were delicious. I have to come back for a full meal, but I definitely know I'll be coming back.

Chuy's where have you been all my life!!??

I'm not typically one to get all hype about a chain restaurant, especially one that has been so overly exploited and commercialized..BUT I have to say it is with great cause that Chuy's has become a household name.

We had a party of 6 on Saturday night and arrived around 6:30 so as expected, we had a long wait.  The outside area has plenty of places to sit while you wait (because you WILL wait) so if it ever stops raining in Charlotte you should be  relatively comfortable while you wait to be seated. 
  It was an hour, not a minute more or less.  The bar area is small and it is pretty challenging to find a spot to stand without creating a major traffic jam but we found a little corner conveniently located by the salsa bar.  Naturally we helped ourselves to a basket of chips and salsa while we waited and that made everything all good.  In fact, the salsa was so good it just got me even more excited about what was yet to come.  The chips were thin and greasy but I will overlook that for now.

My immediate response to the interior was "WOAH"...it was busy, it was bright, it was confusing!  There just seems to be a lot of patterns and colors going on at one time.  The layout of the restaurant seemed a little awkward and even somewhat different from Zink (restaurant there prior).  I guess in the scheme of things it doesn't matter but it just seemed like a poor use of space.  There were too many walls and random tables here and there...no method to the madness, or so it seemed.  I didn't get to check out the outside patio but I am happy they have one!


Once we were sat we asked for a dip that was not offered on the front-end by our waitress.  One of my friends is currently living in Texas so he knew to ask for the verde salsa which was almost like a ranch dressing.  I am glad he was with us because otherwise they had plans on keeping me from this heavenly goodness that I very much needed!!  

We all ordered something different...HUGE burritos, tacos, chalupas, quesadilla's, etc.  I ordered the soft tacos with fajita chicken which came with homemade flour tortillas, charro beans and jalapeno rice.  It was awesome!!  The tortillas were fresh and fluffy and not falling apart...The chicken was juicy and was actually a plump piece of meat as opposed to a shriveled up piece of grilled sodium.  The condiments were fresh and full of flavor.  Everything really was VERY good.

I don't know how they do it but they truly set themselves apart from the traditional Mexican or tex-mex places we have around here.  They definitely gained a new fan.  I hopped right on the bandwagon with no reserve whatsoever.

The only thing that concerns me is the location and the tendency for them to stay packed all the time like cowfish.  When I want a quick Mexican meal I typically want to just bum around and go walk in, get seated right away and have my food come out before I finish ordering.  But this will take some getting used to.  There will be a lot more effort and drama to get to eat here and I don't know that I would personally make the effort on a regular basis but we'll see!

It was OK... not rave-worthy. I tried their Baja taco and it wasn't that good, there was no sauce or maybe my waiter didn't offer it. Oh well... The decor just meh. It made me feel like I was in Monkey Joe's, and have kids crying and throwing stuffs didn't help my situation either. Overall I'm going to stick with my regular visit to Cabo, since I think it suits my taste (no pun intended lol).

Retro, energetic and fun. Chuy's is a blast from the past. 

Kara, our server, was very good and patient with us newbies. The Chips and salsa starter is pretty tasty. The chips were warm and very light. And the salsa has a nice little kick. 

I was hungry so I went with the chicken burrito. With burritos, you can pick your sauce. I'd sugguest taking the sauce your online ahead of time so you don't hold others in your party up. There are several, maybe five or six to choose from. Kara had to help me.  I went with the deluxe tomatillo sauce. Excellent choice. It was a creamy white sauce; I wasn't in the mood for a red sauce after salsa. 

Burritos are HUGE! They come with a choice of rice. I selected Mexican rice. The dish was very tasty. It was just too large even for my hunger status. I probably finished about 3/4 of it before waving the white flag.
Food is good but the service is worst ... we had bug on our place ... manager came and he is like because door is open it come in ... so just be careful about the service

Waited forever for people who came in after me to get seated. The hostesses are idiots very disorganized. There were four of them who sat around and socialized and texted rather than seat people. Food isn't very good either. Would never come back or recommend.

My daughter and I love Chuy's! It is our go to lady's lunch location. Granted she is 4, but that can be a great compliment from a toddler. :-) The stacked enchilada is great. I like to order extra verde sauce on the side because it's so good. Queso is tasty and of course the fresh made tortillas are a treat! The kids meals come with a push pop, which while my daughter loves, she still likes the queso and tortillas best! I think it's the only restaurant in the area that comes close to authentic Tex-Mex. We moved from Texas a year ago, so it was a welcomed find!

Nice new Mexican place in the south park with reasonable prices.  

The place is brightly colored and bigger than it looks from the outside entrance.  The place is still finding it's stride as there was some confusion between hostesses and wait staff.    The outside patio is really nice is the weather is cooperating. 

Their two salsa's with the chips were great. Spicy Red salsa and a creamy white spicy salsa. 

Coming Colorado, I crave a good green chili.  So far i haven't found anyplace that can compare to local west chili's, but this place green chili sauces were still good.  I have the deluxe chicken with their green chili sauce.  It has some neat heat and flavor, but I'm picky with my chilies.

The appetizer sampler was pretty big and offered a good sample.  Also, get the house margarita if its a Tuesday.  ( its on special.)

Dinner with family, for some reason I couldn't convince them to go to our usual taco place. So we thought we'd give Chuy's a try.

The chips and salsa were quite good. Not a puree of tomatoes, there were actual pieces in there. A bit wet, so it's drippy. We also got an order of guacamole to go with it. It arrived in a medium sized bowl and it looked like a lot. Until we got near the bottom and discovered that it was sitting on a small nest of shredded lettuce. Oops. The chips were hot and fresh. Thinner than I'm used to, they had a habit of breaking off in the guac.

Deep menu of burritos and tacos and salads with Mexican beers, sangria and margaritas. When I cut into my "chicken" burrito, it turned out to be beef. The waitress was most apologetic and offered to replace it (she said the kitchen made it wrong even though she ordered it right) but it was good so I stuck with it. My daughter had the Elvis special which is a bucket load of food. Unless you are a serious eater, I'd recommend you move on to something else. My wife had the chicken taco salad which of course comes in a massive fried tortilla shell.

The music and noise in the restaurant is extremely loud. The pictures on the wall and the angles of the walls do nothing to absorb sound at all.

They say it's TexMex, but I dunno. It just seemed like fancy Mexican to me.

Parking isn't easy but it's doable. Try the parking deck for Southpark if it's legal.

I cant say enough great things about this place. It is often super packed, so come early. I love the free queso chips and taco meat that they offer during the week from 4-7.  The Jalapeno ranch is great.I have found that it is on the bar in Texas, however you must request it at the Charlotte location.  We always ask for the waiter Cam. He is excellent!  I have had the flautas and shrimp tacos. I really enjoyed the flautas more. I am looking forward to trying more things on the menu.  This is our go to Friday night spot.

Great food, drinks and service.  This is our local go to place for good Mexican.  The chips were thin n crispy with delicious salsa.  We always get the queso with ground beef to have with our chips as well.  I highly recommend the fajitas and chicka chicka boom boom enchiladas. Side note, if you like slightly spicy ask for a side of jalapeño ranch.  You can eat this with chips or with your meal.  I wish they sold bottles of this deliciousness!  The perfect margarita was exactly that, perfect.  We had one lime and one mango.  Lastly everything is fresh and waiter was very attentive.  He was working quite a few tables but he moved quickly and stayed on top of things.  Manager stopped by all tables to make sure everything was ok.  Very nice gesture.

We visited Chuy's the first week it opened and they were still working through the kinks.  Service was slow and food was kind of blah.  We have visited several times since and have been more impressed with each visit.  Seating was prompt and service was awesome.  The food has been delicious, and we always leave stuffed!  Can't wait to go back!

Not what I was expecting at all! The decor is very funky, odd decorations all over the walls, each room has a different "theme" I'd guess you could say. Paradise style room, hub-cap room, famous Mexicans (im guessing by their pics - don't know who they are though) room, etc.  They have kind of 50's style tables and chairs. 

The food was quite pretty tasty - great salsa!! For drinks I had a margarita, quite good but nothing special. This place is really about the décor and atmosphere, not so much the food.

Best Tip about this place: in the foyer look up!
I don't know why people like this place. There wasn't anything wrong with the service but the food was awful. Very weird... Especially the salsa and sauces.
Everything is nice, clean, the people are friendly and the food is great! What a combination! I'm so glad they decided to move to Waverly it's just another great meal we can look forward to.

I have to say I'm not sure that some of the other reviewers actually ate in the same place I did but I had a great time here and the food was really good. Starting out with the chips, they do it right. Nicely salted to a point where you will always ask for another basket. The people were great, welcoming and happy. But the one thing that will really get your attention is the ceiling which depending on which room you go into has so many wonderful things tacked on to the ceiling. Hubcaps in one, cameras in the other and then of course there is  . . . Elvis!

After moving to North Carolina from Texas, my husband and I decided to drive four hours to chuy's for our wedding anniversary dinner. It was a favorite of ours back in Texas. 

Although the food was probably five stars, the waiter was a negative five. We sat down and he said what do you want to eat and drink? And I was like can we have second to order. He literally came back a minute later and asked again. We ordered an app and our dinner. He didn't explain the menu when I asked a question. We ended up ordering a salad dressing for our enchiladas because he was pushing. 

When we were almost done with our food he took away our plates and put the check on our table. Keep in mind we are the only table with people in the whole section. We were close to the kitchen and he went and high fived the manager. The manager said "wow that was fast." And he replied "what can I say... I have talent." No sir you're lazy and pushed us out of your restaurant and we will not return. Thanks for ruining our experience and anniversaries dinner. 

Circling your patrons to make them feel uncomfortable and leave is rude and messed.

Brittany behind the Bar was fantastic.  She made great recommendations on different margarittas and even gave samples until we found something to our liking.  The Baha Fish tacos were great as well as the chalupas were excellent.  Other than a short wait we had a great time, great music and the Best bartender and service.

I just moved to Charlotte from Dallas-Forth Worth, TX and discovered they had Chuy's! My short time in Texas I fell in love with Tex Mex from all the spices and heat in the food. I've visited their Arlington & Fort Worth Texas locations and they both fall on the same level with this location.

The service is great! I've never ran into any bad servers or any missed items.

While I have only sat at the bar at the Fort Worth location, they were extremely friendly even though they were getting ready to close at the time I went.

The food. That is what it is all about. You HAVE to get boom boom sauce. You can add it to anything for only $1 and it is amazing. I don't know what is in it (nor do I want to because I'm sure it isn't all that good for you...haha) but it is like a spicy cheese dip sauce. Every item I've ever ordered was great quality. I recommend the fajitas burrito, the Chica Chica boom boom, or the Elvis Presley. 

Lastly, the environment is lively and upbeat which wraps this package into a 5 star rating for me!

I was so excited that this restaurant opened. I heard a lot of good things about it. The first few weeks after they opened there were long waits.   After finally eating there I don't know what the hype is all about.

Absolutely the worst food and restaurant experience ever. I could buy microwave or Taco Bell that is better. Staff has no management direction. Pitiful. Do not know how these people are in business. I honestly tried to think of a worse experience and could not come up with one!!! Awful, pitiful, untrained and unprofessional staff!!!!

Being from Texas and having lived in Austin for years, I can say that Chuy's Tex-mex is legit. Handmade tortillas, queso compuesto and a variety of unique sauces for enchiladas (or chips!) are the pillars of its greatness. And don't forget amazingly fresh tortilla chips and salsa and of course, the dot and swirl margaritas! Stop by weekdays from 4-7 to enjoy the free queso bar- you won't regret it! The fun atmosphere and funky decor works for date night, family night or any night!!

Im a fan more so of the playful vibes this place gives off  versus the food! The area first of all let me say is everything where it's located.The bright colors on the outside draws you to want to come in and try it out so i did. Im giving up on eating out at Mexican restaurants that aren't  authentic, i wanted to give it another try. Staff was more than friendly but i don't feel like this is a place i would frequent again. I ordered the chicken stuffed avocado. Pretty tasty it was but it left this weird after taste in my mouth. Would recommend anyone to at least give them a try for i only tried one dish and again it was great but wasn't authentic.
